alert.note: Alert for Kennebec (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 11:09PM EST until December 21 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Maine... Kennebec River at Hallowell affecting Kennebec and Sagadahoc Counties. Kennebec River At Augusta affecting Kennebec County. Kennebec River At North Sidney affecting Kennebec County. Kennebec River At Skowhegan affecting Kennebec and Somerset Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Kennebec River at Augusta. * WHEN...Until Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Water reaches the back of some buildings on Water Street in Augusta. Widespread impacts occur near the waterfront to several businesses in downtown Augusta. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:54 PM EST Monday the stage was 15.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:54 PM EST Monday was 15.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 23.9 feet tomorrow afternoon. This will exceed the flood in May 2023 which crested around 20 feet. It will then fall below flood stage early Thursday afternoon. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
